instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.U5000: What is U5000? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in macbooks from 2013-2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.SYS_DETECT_L: What is SYS_DETECT_L? For detection of the battery.

threads.title: Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no ppbus
threads.message:
water damage (cleaned) no <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0V sometimes 0.7V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 1.8V
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> 16.7V

changed:
<CHIP>U5110</CHIP>
<CHIP>U7090</CHIP> 
<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>
and reball <CHIP>U5000</CHIP>

threads.title: Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no ppbus
threads.message:
Post diode mode to ground at L7130 and L7095.
Check <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> area for corrosion; pay atention to <RESISTOR>R7095</RESISTOR>/96.

threads.title: Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no ppbus
threads.message:
L7130 - 145 2 sides
L7095 - 350 2 sides
<CHIP>U7090</CHIP> was replaced erea look clean 
<RESISTOR>R7095</RESISTOR>/6 look o.k

threads.title: Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no ppbus
Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no ppbus
Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no ppbus
threads.message:
Post diode mode to ground at <CAPACITOR>C7092</CAPACITOR>.
If short, remove the caps one by one amd test each time.
If still short, change <CHIP>U7090</CHIP>.

BTW, at least one of R/<DIODE>D7005</DIODE> is burnt...

threads.title: Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no ppbus
threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C7092</CAPACITOR> diode mode - 328
<RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> nothing , no read
<DIODE>D7005</DIODE> - leg1-135 leg2 - no read leg3 - 334
i was replace r/<DIODE>D7005</DIODE> but the same..:/

Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no ppbus
threads.message: 16.7v an 8.6v now there is green and orange light, but now fan, fan start just with battery

threads.title: Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no ppbus
Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no ppbus
threads.message:
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS with charger only?
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no ppbus
threads.message: o.k fan work with just charger, but its not charge the battery the charging symbol apper just for 1 secound, there is green and orange light, and its work just with charger..

threads.title: Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no ppbus
threads.message:
Did you try known good battery?
Better to test with an old original, instead of crappy chinese bat.
If liquid spilled on battery electronic board, it must be changed.

threads.title: Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no ppbus
threads.message:
update:
<RESISTOR>R7115</RESISTOR>/6 and <CAPACITOR>C7115</CAPACITOR> didnt seat wall...after out the right i was charge but just to 50% , now its not charging and just green light.
i was replace the battery again and the IO and the same.

threads.title: Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no ppbus
threads.message:
Exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage (without battery)?
Check if <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> is 0V.
Post voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.
Be sure <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> is properly soldered.

threads.title: Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no ppbus
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with just battery is 7.4v with just charger is 8.6v
<SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> is 0v
SCL/SDA on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> is 3.4v
<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> looking good

threads.title: Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no ppbus
Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no ppbus
threads.message: SCL/SDA on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> (10,11)   diode mode to ground  512

threads.title: Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage no ppbus
threads.message:
The bus looks good now.
There should be a problem with SMC, or battery.
You can change <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> first, to discard it.
